name: Tracing Materials: From Resource to Waste to Art
description:
What does ‘material’ or ‘medium’ mean to an artist? Do materials themselves provide rich narratives and social histories? Visual artist Arunkumar H G certainly thinks so! In this workshop he delves into the origins and historical contexts of materials, while they transform from resources to waste.

For this workshop, you are encouraged to bring your own accumulation of waste, to examine how we perceive and interpret waste. You will then work with Arunkumar H G to transform these materials into art objects, highlighting the qualities and significance of the seemingly mundane.

name: CARBON Film Festival Day 1
description:
Carbon has been an invisible protagonist on the celluloid screen for a while now. Our lives are saturated with carbon, and the screen reflects its presence everywhere. Though unseen, carbon's influence permeates our lives and finds reflection in countless stories on the big screen. This festival invites you on a journey from the barren grounds of an e-waste dump yard to the magical forests of the Western Ghats. We will showcase a distinctive collection of cinematic narratives centred on the theme of carbon and bring to life stories that span generations, reflecting both the past and the ever-evolving present. These stories of ambition, resilience, and perseverance will offer a deeper understanding of carbon and films, shedding light on the transformative power of carbon.
The festival strives to create an immersive environment where visitors can deeply interact with these ideas through various films and discussions. We are offering a wide array of films spanning different languages, including German, English, French, and Hindi, and genres, from documentary features and narrative features to docufictions and animated shorts. Filmmakers and scholars have been encouraged to create a colourful, interactive space that encourages people of all ages to consider carbon's critical role in our lives and the global ecosystem.

name: Into the Carbonverse: Exploring the World of Animated films
description: How can animation bring climate change themes to life in a compelling and impactful way? Join us for an engaging panel discussion featuring leading animators Aniruddh Shivakumar Menon, Nirupa Rao, and Fabian Driehorst.  Our panellists will address their creative processes and how animation's unique format can successfully communicate the urgency and significance of environmental issues. They will give insights into their practice and will explore both the artistic aspects of animation and its role in advocating for environmental issues. Don't miss out on this opportunity to learn from brilliant animators about the convergence of art, storytelling, and climate advocacy, as well as how their animated narratives influence the global climate change discourse.

name: All that Breathes Film Discussion
description: In one of the world’s most populated cities, two brothers, devote their lives to protecting the black kite, a majestic bird essential to New Delhi’s ecosystem. Amid environmental toxicity and social unrest, the brothers care for these creatures in their makeshift avian basement hospital. "All That Breathes," directed by Shaunak Sen, explores the bond between the kites and the brothers, offering a mesmerizing chronicle of inter-species coexistence. Join us for an insightful discussion featuring director Shaunak Sen and ecologist Suhel Quader, as they delve into the film's powerful themes and its relevance to environmental issues today.
